title: REJECHANCE
author: REJECHANCE
content: HI, I REALLY NEED HELP. COULD IT BE POSSIBLE THAT IT WOULD COST 15K USD TO PAY TO AN BITCOINS ACCELERATOR SITE FOR RETRIEVING 125K USD IN A BLOCKCHAIN THAT'S WHAT CENTRAL MARGINS ASK ME TO PAY.... MY COLD WALLET IS EXODUS. i HAD PUT NEAR 70K OF MY MONEY...

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: Quote from: REJECHANCE on April 07, 2023, 02:00:24 AMHI, I REALLY NEED HELP. COULD IT BE POSSIBLE THAT IT WOULD COST 15K USD TO PAY TO AN BITCOINS ACCELERATOR SITE FOR RETRIEVING 125K USD IN A BLOCKCHAIN THAT'S WHAT CENTRAL MARGINS ASK ME TO PAY.... MY COLD WALLET IS EXODUS. i HAD PUT NEAR 70K OF MY MONEY... retrieving what, could you elaborate your situation more, please?Bitcoin transactions are irreversible and if you made a mistake transaction to a wrong receiving address, when it is confirmed by miners on the network, it is done on Bitcoin blockchain and can not be reverted. So it is no chance for you or anyone to retrieve those coins for you.It is not related to Bitcoin tx accelerator so your question is confusing.If your problem is your transaction is stucked in mempool because you use low fee rate, you can use tx accelerator or you can bump the fee by using RBF opt-in and Bump the fee option in your wallet.Transactions (Compilation for newbies)Use this free tx accelerator: https://www.viabtc.com/tools/txaccelerator/Before using tx accelerator, check your fee rate and current mempools to know what a higher fee rate you should use when you bump the fee.Bitcoin Transaction Fees - Everything in oneTwo good sites to check mempoolshttps://mempool.space/https://jochen-hoenicke.de/queue/#BTC%20(default%20mempool),24h,weightGenerally the offer is scam.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Since your post doesn't make much sense, I have a few questions for you:1. First you say that you have $125k stuck but then you go on about putting $75k of your own money. Care to explain where exactly you put that money?2. Who is asking you to pay $15k? Share some links pls. This is just my guess based on your confusing post, but it looks like you are being scammed by one of those sites that ask you to send money in order to be able to withdraw.

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: Exodus isn't even a cold storage, it's a web wallet although you can use it to connect Trezor, this case Trezor is the cold storage, not the Exodus wallet.I think you're got scammed by a centralized site claimed to be Bitcoin accelerator site, next time use electrum where you can enable RBF feature to bump your fee by yourself without need to ask other party to speed up your transactions.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: Apocollapse on April 07, 2023, 05:31:45 AMExodus isn't even a cold storage, it's a web wallet although you can use it to connect Trezor, this case Trezor is the cold storage, not the Exodus wallet.While I agree that Exodus shouldn't be used for cold storage, are you sure that its a web wallet? I have never used it, but my understanding is that its a non-custodial wallet (albeit crappy one imho) and not the web wallet where you don't have access to your keys like for example blockchain.com.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.created_time: April 07, 2023, 08:07:47 AMLast edit: April 07, 2023, 08:24:34 AM by hosseinimr93
comments.body: You have an unconfirmed transaction and you want to accelerate it using a service that charge you 15,000 dollars for that. Am I getting you right? Can you share your transaction ID here? (Note that with sharing your transaction ID, you may hurt your privacy, but it has nothing to do with your security.)If the transaction includes a change, you can accelerate it using CPFP method on your own without relying on any third party. Quote from: hd49728 on April 07, 2023, 02:41:33 AMUse this free tx accelerator: https://www.viabtc.com/tools/txaccelerator/You can use ViaBTC free service only if the fee rate used for the unconfirmed transaction is at least 10 sat/byte.Quote from: hd49728 on April 07, 2023, 02:41:33 AMBefore using tx accelerator, check your fee rate and current mempools to know what a higher fee rate you should use when you bump the fee.You can bump the fee only if the original transaction has been flagged as RBF. I doubt exodus makes RBF-enabled transactions.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: REJECHANCE on April 07, 2023, 02:00:24 AM~snip~THAT'S WHAT CENTRAL MARGINS ASK ME TO PAY....Is it about this trading platform by any chance? According to everything that can be read about them, it seems that it is a classic scam in which victims are tried to be induced to invest as much money as possible, and problems arise when the victim wants to make the first withdrawal.Obviously, one of the methods is the claim that the transaction is stuck and that some kind of "acceleration" should be paid. I hope the OP will tell us something more, but everything points to a scam.

comments.author: Getmon
comments.body: I already have the impression that you are the victim of investment fraud after reading the $15,000 fee to speed up your bitcoin withdrawal. Your $70,000 investment was made to appear to be worth $125,000. You are not the first person to be asked to deposit additional funds when you want to withdraw a significant amount of money. Regardless, they are not able to scam you anymore for another $15,000 after you inquire here about the costs of speeding up bitcoin transactions. They do not cost hundreds of bucks and there are even free accelerators like viabtc.com.

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: I think Op is scammed by : https://centralmargins.com/We can find dozen of reviews looking like this :They are not licensed or regulated :QuoteCentralMargins Trading Services LLC is incorporated in St. Vincent and the Grenadines as an operating subsidiary within the CentralMargins group of companies. CentralMargins Trading Services LLC is not required to hold any financial services license or authorization in St. Vincent and the Grenadines to offer its products and services.CENTRALMARGINS DOES NOT ACCEPT ANY USERS OR RESIDENTS FROM UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, JAPAN, SAINT VINCENT AND THE GRENADINES, FRANCE, ALGERIA, ECUADOR, IRAN, SYRIA, NORTH KOREA OR SUDAN, UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS, AMERICAN SAMOA, RUSSIAN FEDERATION AND THE COUNTRIES OR TERRITORIES WHERE ITS ACTIVITY SHALL BE ESPECIALLY LICENSED, ACCREDITED OR REGULATED BY OTHER WAYS. YOU SHALL CHECK YOUR APPLICABLE LAW AND BE FULLY RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY NEGATIVE IMPACT ARISEN FROM YOUR RESIDENCE COUNTRY REGULATIONS. IF YOU ARE TRAVELLING TO ANY OF THESE COUNTRIES, YOU ACKNOWLEDGE THAT OUR SERVICES MAY BE UNAVAILABLE AND/OR BLOCKED IN SUCH COUNTRIES.Sorry Op but it doesn't smell good..
